name: hc_arctic_condensation
query: Rooftop installation in Northern Norway. Outdoor temperature: -40¬∞C. Exhaust air: 20¬∞C / 50% RH. We want GDB-FZ.

turns.content: Rooftop installation in Northern Norway. Outdoor temperature: -40¬∞C. Exhaust air: 20¬∞C / 50% RH. We want GDB-FZ.

The GDB housing with FZ material is not suitable for your rooftop installation in Northern Norway due to the risk of outdoor condensation. Outdoor installations expose the system to Outdoor Condensation and High Humidity. The GDB housing has a C2 corrosion class and bolted construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for outdoor environments. To prevent condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces, a double-wall insulated housing is required to maintain the surface above the dew point.Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need to be rated for outdoor installation (ENV_OUTDOOR) and have a construction type that meets the necessary leakage and hygiene requirements. I recommend contacting the manufacturer's Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.I am pivoting to the GDMI FLEX series, which is better suited for your application. To finalize the configuration, I need to know the filter dimensions and the airflow for your application.

gemini.explanation: The system provided an excellent technical evaluation. It correctly identified that the GDB housing is uninsulated and rated for indoor use only (PDF p.8), making it physically unsuitable for a -40¬∞C outdoor installation due to severe condensation risks. It appropriately pivoted to the insulated GDMI FLEX series (PDF p.18) as a better technical fit while correctly warning that standard catalog products are indoor-rated, thus advising contact with custom engineering for a fully compliant outdoor solution.

dimension_explanations.correctness: The system correctly states GDB is uninsulated and for indoor use (PDF p.8), and that GDMI FLEX is insulated (PDF p.18).
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response explains the failure mode (condensation), suggests the correct alternative platform, and asks for the necessary sizing parameters.
dimension_explanations.safety: The system correctly blocked a dangerous configuration where an uninsulated housing at -40¬∞C would cause freezing/condensation issues.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The physics-based reasoning regarding dew points and condensation on non-insulated surfaces is technically sound and appropriate for HVAC engineering.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: The system respected the 'F√∂r inomhusbruk' (For indoor use) constraint found in the PDF for these products by flagging the outdoor requirement as non-standard.

strengths: Correctly identified GDB as uninsulated and indoor-only (PDF p.8)
Applied sound physics reasoning regarding condensation at -40¬∞C
Appropriately managed the 'Indoor use' constraint by suggesting custom engineering while offering the best available standard alternative

content_segments.inference_logic: Outdoor installation causes condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces. Double-wall insulated housing required to maintain surface above dew point.
Persistent humidity accelerates zinc corrosion, reducing service life. Consider C4 or C5 materials.

content_segments.text: . The GDB housing has a C2 corrosion class and bolted construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for outdoor environments. To prevent condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces, a double-wall insulated housing is required to maintain the surface above the dew point.

Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need to be rated for outdoor installation (ENV_OUTDOOR) and have a construction type that meets the necessary leakage and hygiene requirements. I recommend contacting the manufacturer's Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.
